intro: Appendicula lucida, commonly known as the shining appendicula, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant features delicate, spurred petals that are often white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are typically oval and arranged in a whorled pattern around the stem. Appendicula lucida thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands and forests.
